comment.author: 22948027@N02
comment._content: Text in Norwegian, first picture: "Hvalblaast forut!" - Thar she blows, straigh ahead! Second: "Hvalfangst med HB Knöl" - Hunting with HB Knöl Third: "Da skuddet gik" - the harpoon has been fired Fourth: "Fast fisk" - phrase meaning that the harpoon has "taken", but difficult to translate literally. The very well-known Norwegian expression is also technically wrong, but nevertheless it was always used: it refers to "fish".
